docs.title: Release Agent
docs.text:
Autonomous release preparation agent for multi-language repositories.

Release Agent validates code quality, generates changelogs, updates documentation, and manages the complete release lifecycle. It supports monorepos with multiple languages and integrates with Claude Code as an interactive subagent.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Auto-detection - Detects Go, TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Rust, Swift
  • Validation checks - Build, test, lint, format, security, documentation checks
  • Monorepo support - Handles repositories with multiple languages
  • Changelog generation - Integrates with schangelog for automated changelogs
  • Documentation updates - Updates README badges and version references
  • Release workflow - Full release lifecycle with CI verification
  • Interactive mode - Ask questions and propose fixes for Claude Code integration
  • Multiple output formats - Human-readable, JSON, and TOON (Token-Oriented Object Notation)
  • Claude Code plugin - Available as a plugin with commands, skills, and agents

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
# Run validation checks
release-agent-team check

# Comprehensive Go/No-Go validation
release-agent-team validate --version=v1.0.0

# Execute full release workflow
release-agent-team release v1.0.0

docs.title: Validation Areas
docs.text:
Release Agent validates four distinct areas:

Area Checks QA Build, tests, lint, format, error handling compliance Documentation README, PRD, TRD, release notes, CHANGELOG Release Version validation, git status, CI configuration Security LICENSE file, vulnerability scan, dependency audit, secret detection

docs.title: Supported Languages
docs.text: Language Detection Status Go go.mod Full support TypeScript package.json + tsconfig.json Full support JavaScript package.json Full support Python pyproject.toml, setup.py Detection only Rust Cargo.toml Detection only Swift Package.swift Detection only

docs.title: Building the Documentation
docs.text:
To build the docs locally:

pip install mkdocs-material
mkdocs serve

To deploy to GitHub Pages:

mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Release Agent can be configured via a .releaseagent.yaml file in your repository root.

docs.title: Configuration File
docs.text:
Create .releaseagent.yaml in your project root:

# Global settings
verbose: false

# Language-specific settings
languages:
  go:
    enabled: true
    test: true
    lint: true
    format: true
    coverage: false
    exclude_coverage: "cmd"

  typescript:
    enabled: true
    paths: ["frontend/"]
    test: true
    lint: true
    format: true

  javascript:
    enabled: false  # disable for this repo

docs.title: Global Options
docs.text: Option Type Default Description verbose bool false Enable verbose output

docs.title: Language Options
docs.text:
Each language can be configured with these options:

Option Type Default Description enabled bool true Enable/disable language checks paths []string auto Specific paths to check test bool true Run tests lint bool true Run linter format bool true Check formatting

docs.title: Go-Specific Options
docs.text: Option Type Default Description coverage bool false Show coverage report exclude_coverage string "cmd" Directories to exclude from coverage

docs.title: Go Project
docs.text:
verbose: false

languages:
  go:
    enabled: true
    test: true
    lint: true
    format: true
    coverage: true
    exclude_coverage: "cmd,internal/generated"

docs.title: TypeScript Project
docs.text:
languages:
  typescript:
    enabled: true
    test: true
    lint: true
    format: true

docs.title: Monorepo
docs.text:
languages:
  go:
    enabled: true
    paths: ["backend/"]

  typescript:
    enabled: true
    paths: ["frontend/", "shared/"]

  javascript:
    enabled: false

docs.title: CI-Only Testing
docs.text:
For faster local checks, disable tests:

# .releaseagent.yaml - local development
languages:
  go:
    test: false  # Run tests in CI only
    lint: true
    format: true

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
Some settings can be overridden via environment variables:

Variable Description RELEASEAGENT_VERBOSE Enable verbose output RELEASEAGENT_CONFIG Path to config file

docs.title: Command-Line Override
docs.text:
Command-line flags override configuration file settings:

# Config says test: true, but skip tests for this run
release-agent-team check --no-test

docs.title: Legacy Configuration
docs.text:
For backwards compatibility, .prepush.yaml is also supported but deprecated. Rename to .releaseagent.yaml:

mv .prepush.yaml .releaseagent.yaml

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
To validate your configuration:

release-agent-team check --verbose

The verbose output shows which configuration options are being used.

docs.title: Output Formats
docs.text: Release Agent supports multiple output formats for different use cases.

docs.title: Available Formats
docs.text: Format Flag Description Human (default) Colored terminal output with symbols JSON --json --format=json Standard JSON for programmatic use TOON --json --format=toon Token-optimized format for LLMs Team --format team Template-based box report (validate only)

docs.title: Human-Readable (Default)
docs.text:
The default format provides colored terminal output with Unicode symbols:

=== Pre-push Checks ===

Detecting languages...
  Found: go in .

Running Go checks...

=== Summary ===
✓ Go: no local replace directives
✓ Go: mod tidy
✓ Go: build
✓ Go: gofmt
✓ Go: golangci-lint
✓ Go: tests
⚠ Go: untracked references (warning)

Passed: 6, Failed: 0, Skipped: 0, Warnings: 1

Pre-push checks passed with warnings.

docs.title: Symbols
docs.text: Symbol Meaning ✓ Check passed ✗ Check failed ⚠ Warning ⊘ Skipped

docs.title: JSON Format
docs.text:
Standard JSON output for programmatic consumption:

release-agent-team check --json --format=json

{
  "results": [
    {
      "name": "Go: build",
      "passed": true,
      "skipped": false,
      "warning": false,
      "output": ""
    },
    {
      "name": "Go: tests",
      "passed": true,
      "skipped": false,
      "warning": false,
      "output": "ok  \tgithub.com/example/project\t0.042s"
    }
  ],
  "summary": {
    "passed": 7,
    "failed": 0,
    "skipped": 0,
    "warnings": 1
  }
}

docs.title: TOON Format
docs.text:
Token-Oriented Object Notation is approximately 8x more token-efficient than JSON, optimized for LLM consumption:

release-agent-team check --json --format=toon

RESULTS
name:Go: build|passed:true|skipped:false|warning:false
name:Go: tests|passed:true|output:ok github.com/example/project 0.042s
SUMMARY
passed:7|failed:0|skipped:0|warnings:1

docs.title: When to Use TOON
docs.text:
• When integrating with Claude Code or other LLMs
  • When token efficiency matters (API costs)
  • When output will be parsed by AI assistants

docs.title: Status Icons
docs.text: Icon Status Meaning 🟢 GO Check passed 🟡 WARN Warning (doesn't block) 🔴 NO-GO Check failed ⚪ SKIP Check skipped

docs.title: When to Use Team Format
docs.text:
• Release readiness reviews
  • Team status meetings
  • Documentation of release decisions
  • Audit trails

docs.title: Combining Formats
docs.text:
Some flags can be combined:

# JSON output with TOON format
release-agent-team check --json --format=toon

# Verbose human-readable
release-agent-team check --verbose

# Team format with verbose details
release-agent-team validate --format team --verbose

docs.title: JSON in Shell
docs.text:
# Get pass/fail status
release-agent-team check --json --format=json | jq '.summary.failed'

# List failed checks
release-agent-team check --json --format=json | jq '.results[] | select(.passed == false)'

docs.title: TOON in Python
docs.text:
def parse_toon(output):
    results = []
    for line in output.split('\n'):
        if '|' in line:
            fields = dict(f.split(':') for f in line.split('|'))
            results.append(fields)
    return results

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: Release Agent provides seven commands for different stages of the release lifecycle.

docs.title: Command Overview
docs.text: Command Description check Run validation checks for detected languages validate Comprehensive Go/No-Go validation across all areas release Execute the full release workflow changelog Generate or update changelog readme Update README badges and versions roadmap Update roadmap using sroadmap version Show version information

docs.title: Global Flags
docs.text:
These flags are available for all commands:

Flag Short Description --verbose -v Show detailed output --interactive -i Enable interactive mode --json Output as structured data --format Output format: toon, json, or team (validate only)

docs.title: Pre-Push Validation
docs.text:
Run before pushing to catch issues early:

release-agent-team check

docs.title: Release Readiness
docs.text:
Check if the project is ready for release:

release-agent-team validate --version=v1.0.0

docs.title: Full Release
docs.text:
Execute the complete release workflow:

release-agent-team release v1.0.0

docs.title: Generate Documentation
docs.text:
Update changelog and documentation:

release-agent-team changelog --since=v0.9.0
release-agent-team readme --version=v1.0.0
release-agent-team roadmap

docs.title: changelog
docs.text: Generate or update changelog using schangelog.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: release-agent-team changelog [directory] [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The changelog command generates or updates the changelog by integrating with schangelog. It parses conventional commits and organizes them into a structured changelog format.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: Argument Description Default directory Directory to process Current directory (.)

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description --since Generate from this version/tag --dry-run Preview changes without writing --verbose, -v Show detailed output

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
This command requires schangelog to be installed:

go install github.com/grokify/structured-changelog/cmd/schangelog@latest

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Generate changelog for all commits
release-agent-team changelog

# Generate since a specific version
release-agent-team changelog --since=v0.9.0

# Preview without writing
release-agent-team changelog --dry-run

# Verbose output
release-agent-team changelog --since=v0.9.0 --verbose

docs.title: Output Files
docs.text:
The command updates:

  • CHANGELOG.json - Structured changelog data
  • CHANGELOG.md - Human-readable changelog

docs.title: Conventional Commits
docs.text:
The changelog generator categorizes commits based on conventional commit prefixes:

Prefix Category feat: Added fix: Fixed docs: Documentation style: Changed refactor: Changed perf: Changed test: Tests build: Build ci: CI chore: Chore

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Meaning 0 Changelog generated successfully 1 Error generating changelog

docs.title: check
docs.text: Run validation checks for all detected languages.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: release-agent-team check [directory] [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The check command runs pre-push validation checks for all detected languages in your repository. It automatically detects Go, TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Rust, and Swift projects and runs appropriate checks for each.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: Argument Description Default directory Directory to check Current directory (.)

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description --verbose, -v Show detailed output --no-test Skip test execution --no-lint Skip linting --no-format Skip format checking --coverage Show coverage report (Go only) --go-no-go NASA-style Go/No-Go report

docs.title: Go Checks
docs.text:
When Go is detected (go.mod present), the following checks run:

Check Type Description no local replace Hard Fails if go.mod has local replace directives mod tidy Hard Fails if go.mod/go.sum need updating build Hard Fails if project doesn't compile gofmt Hard Fails if code isn't formatted golangci-lint Hard Fails if linter reports issues tests Hard Fails if tests fail error handling Hard Fails if errors are improperly discarded untracked refs Soft Warns if tracked files reference untracked files coverage Soft Reports coverage (requires gocoverbadge)

docs.title: TypeScript/JavaScript Checks
docs.text:
When TypeScript or JavaScript is detected, the following checks run:

Check Type Description eslint Hard Fails if linter reports issues prettier Hard Fails if code isn't formatted tsc --noEmit Hard TypeScript type checking npm test Hard Fails if tests fail

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Check current directory
release-agent-team check

# Check specific directory
release-agent-team check ./myproject

# Verbose output
release-agent-team check --verbose

# Skip tests (faster for quick checks)
release-agent-team check --no-test

# Show coverage report
release-agent-team check --coverage

# NASA-style Go/No-Go report
release-agent-team check --go-no-go

docs.title: Default Format
docs.text:

docs.text: Code Meaning 0 All checks passed (warnings don't affect exit code) 1 One or more checks failed

docs.title: readme
docs.text: Update README badges and version references.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: release-agent-team readme [directory] [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The readme command updates version references and badges in your README file. It can update coverage badges, version shields, and other dynamic content.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: Argument Description Default directory Directory to process Current directory (.)

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description --version Version to update to --dry-run Preview changes without writing --verbose, -v Show detailed output

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Update README with current version
release-agent-team readme

# Update to specific version
release-agent-team readme --version=v1.0.0

# Preview changes

docs.title: Coverage Badge
docs.text:
If gocoverbadge is available, the coverage badge is regenerated:

![Coverage](https://img.shields.io/badge/coverage-85%25-green)

docs.title: Version References
docs.text:
Version strings in installation instructions:

go install github.com/example/project@v1.0.0

docs.title: Badge URLs
docs.text: Version-specific badge URLs are updated to reflect the new version.

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Meaning 0 README updated successfully 1 Error updating README

docs.title: release
docs.text: Execute the full release workflow.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: release-agent-team release <version> [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The release command orchestrates the complete release workflow, from validation through tagging. It ensures all checks pass, generates documentation, waits for CI, and only tags after everything succeeds.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: Argument Description Required version Release version (e.g., v1.0.0) Yes

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Description --dry-run Preview what would happen without making changes --skip-ci Don't wait for CI to pass --skip-changelog Don't generate changelog --skip-roadmap Don't update roadmap --verbose, -v Show detailed output --interactive, -i Enable interactive mode

docs.title: Workflow Steps
docs.text:
The release command executes these 9 steps in order:

Step Action Description 1 Validate Version Check version format and availability 2 Check Directory Ensure working directory is clean 3 Run Checks Execute all validation checks 4 Generate Changelog Update CHANGELOG via schangelog 5 Update Roadmap Update ROADMAP via sroadmap 6 Create Commit Create release commit 7 Push Push to remote repository 8 Wait for CI Poll GitHub Actions until pass/fail 9 Create Tag Create and push release tag

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Execute full release
release-agent-team release v1.0.0

# Preview without making changes
release-agent-team release v1.0.0 --dry-run

# Skip CI waiting (dangerous - tag before CI passes)
release-agent-team release v1.0.0 --skip-ci

# Verbose output
release-agent-team release v1.0.0 --verbose

# Interactive mode (for Claude Code)
release-agent-team release v1.0.0 --interactive

docs.title: Successful Release
docs.text:

      ✓ CHANGELOG.md updated

Release v1.0.0 complete!

docs.title: Dry Run
docs.text:
[DRY RUN] Would execute the following:

[1/9] Validate version v1.0.0
[2/9] Check working directory
[3/9] Run validation checks
[4/9] Generate changelog
[5/9] Update roadmap
[6/9] Create commit: chore(release): v1.0.0
[7/9] Push to origin/main
[8/9] Wait for CI
[9/9] Create tag v1.0.0

No changes made.

docs.title: CI Waiting
docs.text: The release command waits for CI to pass before creating the tag. This prevents tagging code that fails CI.

docs.title: Timeout
docs.text: By default, CI waiting times out after 10 minutes. You can skip CI waiting with --skip-ci, but this is not recommended.

docs.title: Supported CI Systems
docs.text: • GitHub Actions (via gh CLI)

docs.title: Interactive Mode
docs.text:
With --interactive, Release Agent can:

  • Ask questions when issues arise
  • Propose fixes for problems
  • Get approval before making changes

This is designed for use with Claude Code:

release-agent-team release v1.0.0 --interactive --json

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Meaning 0 Release completed successfully 1 Release failed at some step

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Always use dry-run first: Preview what will happen before executing
  2. Don't skip CI: Let CI verify the release before tagging
  3. Use semantic versioning: Follow semver for version numbers
  4. Keep working directory clean: Commit or stash changes before releasing

docs.title: validate
docs.text: Run comprehensive release validation across all areas of responsibility.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: release-agent-team validate [directory] [flags]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The validate command performs comprehensive Go/No-Go validation across four distinct areas: QA, Documentation, Release, and Security. It assumes Engineering and Product have already signed off and validates the remaining areas.

docs.title: Arguments

docs.title: Flags

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: This guide walks you through your first use of Release Agent.

docs.title: Your First Check
docs.text:
Navigate to a Go, TypeScript, or JavaScript project and run:

release-agent-team check

Release Agent automatically detects the language(s) in your repository and runs appropriate checks.

docs.text:

Detecting languages...
  Found: go in .

Running Go checks...

=== Summary ===
✓ Go: no local replace directives
✓ Go: mod tidy
✓ Go: build
✓ Go: gofmt
✓ Go: golangci-lint
✓ Go: tests
✓ Go: error handling compliance

docs.title: Comprehensive Validation
docs.text:
For a full release readiness assessment:

release-agent-team validate --version=v1.0.0

This runs checks across all four validation areas:

  • QA - Build, tests, lint, format
  • Documentation - README, CHANGELOG, release notes
  • Release - Version availability, git status
  • Security - LICENSE, vulnerabilities, secrets

docs.title: Execute a Release
docs.text:
When you're ready to release:

# Preview what will happen
release-agent-team release v1.0.0 --dry-run

# Execute the release
release-agent-team release v1.0.0

The release workflow:

  1. Validates version format and availability
  2. Checks working directory is clean
  3. Runs all validation checks
  4. Generates changelog via schangelog
  5. Updates roadmap via sroadmap
  6. Creates release commit
  7. Pushes to remote
  8. Waits for CI to pass
  9. Creates and pushes release tag

docs.title: Interactive Mode
docs.text:
When running with --interactive, Release Agent can:

  • Ask questions when issues arise
  • Propose fixes for problems
  • Get approval before making changes

docs.title: Example Interaction
docs.text:
Claude: I'll run the release checks for v1.0.0.

[Running release-agent-team check --interactive --json]

Release Agent: Found 2 lint issues. Would you like me to:
1. Show the issues and let you fix them
2. Propose automatic fixes
3. Skip lint checks for this release

User: 2

- main.go:42: Add error handling for Close()
- utils.go:18: Remove unused variable

Apply these fixes? [y/n]

docs.title: Version Analysis
docs.text:
Analyzes commits to suggest appropriate version bumps:

  • feat: commits → minor version
  • fix: commits → patch version
  • BREAKING CHANGE: → major version

docs.title: Commit Classification
docs.text: Classifies commits by conventional commit type for changelog generation.

docs.title: Release Coordinator Agent
docs.text:
The release coordinator agent can orchestrate complete releases autonomously:

  1. Analyzes current state
  2. Determines appropriate version
  3. Runs all checks
  4. Generates documentation
  5. Creates release commit
  6. Manages CI verification
  7. Creates release tag

docs.title: Invoking the Agent
docs.text: @release-agent Please prepare the v1.0.0 release

docs.title: TOON Format
docs.text:
For token-efficient communication, use TOON format:

release-agent-team check --json --format=toon

TOON is approximately 8x more token-efficient than JSON.

docs.title: JSON Protocol
docs.text:
For structured communication:

release-agent-team check --interactive --json

Questions and proposals are returned as structured JSON:

{
  "type": "question",
  "id": "lint-fix-proposal",
  "message": "Found 2 lint issues. How should I proceed?",
  "options": [
    {"id": "show", "label": "Show issues"},
    {"id": "fix", "label": "Auto-fix"},
    {"id": "skip", "label": "Skip"}
  ]
}

docs.title: SessionStart Hook
docs.text:
The plugin includes a SessionStart hook that checks for required dependencies:

  • git - Version control
  • gh - GitHub CLI
  • schangelog - Changelog generation (optional)
  • golangci-lint - Go linting (optional)

Missing optional dependencies trigger warnings, not errors.

enabled: true
auto_fix: false  # Require approval for fixes

If CI takes longer than expected:

release-agent-team release v1.0.0 --skip-ci

Note: This tags before CI passes, which is not recommended.

docs.title: Git Hooks Integration
docs.text: Release Agent can be used as a git pre-push hook to automatically validate code before pushing.

docs.title: Option 1: Simple Script
docs.text:
Create .git/hooks/pre-push manually:

cat > .git/hooks/pre-push << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
exec release-agent-team check
EOF

chmod +x .git/hooks/pre-push

docs.title: Option 2: Symlink
docs.text:
Create a symlink to the Release Agent binary:

ln -sf $(which release-agent-team) .git/hooks/pre-push

Note: This runs release-agent-team with no arguments, which defaults to check.

docs.title: Option 3: Shared Hooks Directory
docs.text:
For team-wide hooks, use a shared hooks directory:

# Create shared hooks directory
mkdir -p .githooks

# Create the hook
cat > .githooks/pre-push << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
exec release-agent-team check
EOF

chmod +x .githooks/pre-push

# Configure git to use shared hooks
git config core.hooksPath .githooks

Commit .githooks/ to your repository so all team members use the same hooks.

docs.title: Hook Behavior
docs.text:
When the pre-push hook runs:

  1. Release Agent detects languages in your repository
  2. Runs all enabled checks for each language
  3. Exits with code 0 (success) if all hard checks pass
  4. Exits with code 1 (failure) if any hard check fails

docs.title: Warnings Don't Block
docs.text:
Soft warnings (like untracked references) don't block the push:

=== Summary ===
✓ Go: build
✓ Go: tests
⚠ Go: untracked references (warning)

Passed: 6, Failed: 0, Skipped: 0, Warnings: 1

Pre-push checks passed with warnings.

docs.title: Bypassing the Hook
docs.text:
To push without running checks (use sparingly):

git push --no-verify

Or:

git push -n

docs.title: Skip Certain Checks
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Skip tests for faster push (run in CI)
exec release-agent-team check --no-test

docs.title: Verbose Output
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
exec release-agent-team check --verbose

docs.title: Different Config for Hooks
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
# Use hook-specific config
RELEASEAGENT_CONFIG=.releaseagent.hooks.yaml exec release-agent-team check

docs.title: CI Integration
docs.text:
For complete coverage, run Release Agent in both:

  1. Pre-push hook - Fast feedback during development
  2. CI pipeline - Comprehensive checks with full test suite

docs.title: GitHub Actions Example
docs.text:
name: Release Agent Checks
on: [push, pull_request]

jobs:
  check:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-go@v5
        with:
          go-version: '1.21'
      - name: Install Release Agent
        run: go install github.com/grokify/release-agent/cmd/releaseagent@latest
      - name: Run checks
        run: release-agent-team check

docs.title: Hook Not Running
docs.text:
Check that the hook is executable:

ls -la .git/hooks/pre-push
# Should show -rwxr-xr-x

docs.title: Wrong Directory
docs.text:
The hook runs in the repository root. Use absolute paths if needed:

#!/bin/bash
cd "$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel)"
exec release-agent-team check

docs.title: Release Agent Not Found
docs.text:
Ensure Release Agent is in your PATH:

#!/bin/bash
export PATH="$HOME/go/bin:$PATH"
exec release-agent-team check

docs.title: Slow Hooks
docs.text:
For faster feedback, skip time-consuming checks:

#!/bin/bash
# Fast checks only - full checks run in CI
exec release-agent-team check --no-test --no-coverage

docs.title: Recommended Setup
docs.text:
1. Use shared hooks directory (Option 3)
  2. Commit .githooks/ to repository
  3. Document in README how to enable:
## Development Setup

Enable git hooks:
\`\`\`bash
git config core.hooksPath .githooks
\`\`\`

docs.title: When to Bypass
docs.text:
Only bypass hooks (--no-verify) when:

  • Pushing work-in-progress to a feature branch
  • CI will catch any issues
  • You understand the risks

Never bypass when pushing to main or release branches.

docs.title: Release Notes - v0.2.0
docs.text: Release Date: 2026-01-04

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This release adds new Go checks, introduces a soft warnings system for non-blocking issues, and fixes a critical bug in directory detection. The README has been expanded with comprehensive git hook setup instructions.

docs.title: New Go Checks
docs.text:
Three new checks for Go projects:

Check Type Description go mod tidy Hard Fails if go.mod/go.sum need updating go build Hard Fails if project doesn't compile untracked refs Soft Warns if tracked files reference untracked files

docs.title: Soft Warnings System
docs.text:
New Warning field in check results allows checks to report issues without failing the build:

=== Summary ===
✓ Go: no local replace directives
✓ Go: mod tidy
✓ Go: build
⚠ Go: untracked references (warning)
  main.go may reference untracked utils.go

Passed: 6, Failed: 0, Skipped: 0, Warnings: 1

Pre-push checks passed with warnings.

Soft checks are useful for:

  • Informational checks (coverage reporting)
  • Heuristic checks that may have false positives (untracked references)
  • Checks you want visibility into but don't want to block on

docs.title: Expanded Git Hook Documentation
docs.text:
Three options for setting up releaseagent as a git hook:

  1. Script: Create .git/hooks/pre-push manually
  2. Symlink: ln -sf $(which release-agent-team) .git/hooks/pre-push
  3. Shared hooks: Use .githooks/ directory with git config core.hooksPath

docs.title: Directory Walking Fix
docs.text:
Fixed a critical bug where Release Agent would skip the current directory when run with . as the target. The issue was that filepath.WalkDir returns . as the first entry, and the hidden directory check (name[0] == '.') incorrectly matched it.

Before: Running in a Go project reported "No supported languages detected" After: Correctly detects Go and runs all checks

docs.title: Highlights
docs.text: This release transforms Release Agent from a pre-push validation tool into a comprehensive release automation platform. Major additions include a full release workflow engine, Claude Code integration, and multi-platform plugin support.

docs.title: CLI Restructure
docs.text:
• Cobra framework: Migrated to spf13/cobra for better command organization
  • New command structure: releaseagent <command> [flags]
  • 7 commands: check, validate, release, changelog, readme, roadmap, version

docs.title: Release Workflow Engine
docs.text:
• release-agent-team release <version>: Execute complete 9-step release workflow
  • Steps: Validate version → Check working directory → Run checks → Generate changelog → Update roadmap → Create commit → Push → Wait for CI → Create tag
  • CI verification: Waits for GitHub Actions to pass before tagging (via gh CLI)
  • Dry-run support: Preview what would happen without making changes

docs.title: Comprehensive Validation
docs.text:
• release-agent-team validate: NASA-style Go/No-Go validation across 4 areas
  • QA Area: Build, test, lint, format, error handling
  • Documentation Area: README, PRD, TRD, release notes, changelog
  • Release Area: Version format, git status, CI configuration
  • Security Area: LICENSE, vulnerability scan, dependency audit, secret detection

docs.title: Actions Framework
docs.text:
• Action interface: Run(), Propose(), Apply() pattern for mutating operations
  • ChangelogAction: Generate changelogs via schangelog integration
  • RoadmapAction: Update roadmaps via sroadmap integration
  • ReadmeAction: Update version references and coverage badges

docs.title: Interactive Mode
docs.text:
• --interactive flag: Enable Q&A mode for Claude Code integration
  • Prompter interface: CLIPrompter for terminal, JSONPrompter for AI assistants
  • Proposal system: Review and approve changes before applying

docs.title: Output Formats
docs.text:
• Human-readable: Colored terminal output with symbols (✓, ✗, ⚠, ⊘)
  • JSON: Standard JSON output (--json --format=json)
  • TOON: Token-Oriented Object Notation (--json --format=toon) - ~8x more token-efficient for LLMs

docs.title: Claude Code Plugin
docs.text:
• Plugin structure: Commands, skills, agents, and hooks
  • 4 commands: /release-agent:release, /release-agent:check, /release-agent:changelog, /release-agent:version-next
  • 2 skills: Version analysis, commit classification
  • Release coordinator agent: Orchestrates complete releases

docs.title: New Checks

  • SecurityChecker: LICENSE, govulncheck, dependency audit, secret detection
  • DocChecker: Validates documentation completeness
  • ReleaseChecker: Version format, git status, CI configuration

docs.title: Git Integration

  • WaitForCI: Block until CI passes or fails (with timeout)

docs.title: Highlights
docs.text:

  • Unified Schema: JSON output conforms to team-report.schema.json and agent-result.schema.json
  • Richer Metadata: Reports include GeneratedAt, GeneratedBy, $schema, and per-team Status fields

docs.title: Report Architecture
docs.text:
The report package has been refactored to use types from the multi-agent-spec SDK:

Local Type (Removed) Multi-Agent-Spec Type TeamStatusReport multiagentspec.TeamReport Team multiagentspec.TeamSection Check multiagentspec.Check Status multiagentspec.Status

docs.title: DAG-Aware Sorting
docs.text:
Teams are now sorted according to the DAG workflow structure:

  1. PM Agent - No dependencies, runs first
  2. Docs, QA, Security Agents - Depend on PM, sorted alphabetically
  3. Release Agent - Depends on all others, runs last

The DependsOn field in TeamSection tracks dependencies, and SortByDAG() performs topological sorting using Kahn's algorithm with alphabetical tie-breaking for deterministic output.

// TeamConfig now includes DAG dependencies
type TeamConfig struct {
    Area      checks.ValidationArea
    ID        string
    Name      string
    DependsOn []string  // NEW: tracks upstream dependencies
}

docs.title: Enhanced Report Fields
docs.text:
Reports now include additional metadata:

{
  "$schema": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/agentplexus/multi-agent-spec/main/schema/report/team-report.schema.json",
  "project": "github.com/agentplexus/release-agent-team",
  "version": "v0.5.0",
  "generated_at": "2026-01-17T12:00:00Z",
  "generated_by": "release-agent-team",
  "status": "GO"
}

docs.title: Canonical Renderer
docs.text:
The box-format renderer is now provided by multi-agent-spec and automatically sorts teams by DAG order:

import multiagentspec "github.com/agentplexus/multi-agent-spec/sdk/go"

renderer := multiagentspec.NewRenderer(os.Stdout)
renderer.Render(teamReport)  // Auto-sorts by DAG before rendering
